p: The pharmacopoeial raw material is the dried A. absinthium herb ( Absinthii herba). According to the latest editions (9th and 10th) of the European Pharmacopoeia and the 11th Polish Pharmacopoeia, it is recommended to harvest the herb from young plants—in their first year of vegetation, basal leaves are cut off, and from older plants—sparsely leaved, flowering shoot tips. One can also use a mixture of them, as well as whole or broken-up fragments of the A. absinthium plant. The raw material is standardized for essential oil content; in the dried herb, this content must not be less than 2 mL/kg [ 12]. In addition, the bitterness index of the raw material must not be less than 10,000 [ 12].
